translated: Wisdom is nonconceptual.

original: de ni 'dus byas ma thob bar rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dus byas ma thob bar rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not suitable to obtain the conditioned through it.”

original: 'dus ma byas kyang mig gi lam las 'das pas de'ang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang mig gi lam las 'das pas de'ang mi mthong ngo //
translated: Since the unconditioned is beyond the path of the eye, it is not seen.

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal; yang dag par zhugs pa'i dge slong 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs yod dam /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal; yang dag par zhugs pa'i dge slong 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs yod dam /
translated: ” “Mañjuśrī, is there a category of fully ordained monks who have entered the authentic path but have not attained the result?

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa /
translated: ” “Brahmā,

original: yang dag par sbyor ba la 'bras bu thob pa med pa'ang yod do; ;yang dag pa'i sbyor ba ni gang la'ang mi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba la 'bras bu thob pa med pa'ang yod do; ;yang dag pa'i sbyor ba ni gang la'ang mi sbyor ba'o //
translated: there is a category of those who have entered the authentic path but have not attained the result.🔽Those who have entered the authentic path do not engage in any way.

original: de la 'bras bu thob par rnam par rtog pa'ang med de /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu thob par rnam par rtog pa'ang med de /
translated: They do not conceptualize the attainment of the result.

original: tshangs pa / 'thob pa med pa las 'thob par lta'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa / 'thob pa med pa las 'thob par lta'o //
translated: Brahmā, those who do not attain see attainment.

original: gang 'thob pa de ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'thob pa de ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Those who attain are full of pride.

original: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba la ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'ang med /🔽thob pa'ang med /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba la ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'ang med / thob pa'ang med /
translated: Those who have entered the authentic path have no pride and no lack of pride.🔽They have no attainment.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'ang @109b med do //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'ang @109b med do //
translated: They have no realization.

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: ” “Mañjuśrī,

original: chos gang dag mngon du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir khong du chud pa zhes bstan /
analyzed: chos gang dag mngon du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir khong du chud pa zhes bstan /
translated: “Brahmā, it is said that one should understand those phenomena that are to be realized.

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /🔽chos gang ma skyes /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa / chos gang ma skyes /
translated: ” He replied, “Brahmā,🔽those phenomena that are unborn,

original: ma bskyed / bskyed par mi 'gyur ba'i chos de dag mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir khong du chud pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ma bskyed / bskyed par mi 'gyur ba'i chos de dag mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir khong du chud pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: not produced, and will not be produced are said to be realized.

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: ” He asked, “Mañjuśrī,

original: ma skyes pa'i chos la mngon par rtogs pa gang yin /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos la mngon par rtogs pa gang yin /
translated: what is the realization of unborn phenomena?

original: smras pa / gang mi skye ba 'di nyid mngon par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / gang mi skye ba 'di nyid mngon par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: ” He replied, “This very non-production is realization.

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas thams cad ma skyes par mthong zhing yang dag pa nyid du nges par 'jug par zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas thams cad ma skyes par mthong zhing yang dag pa nyid du nges par 'jug par zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one sees all conditioned things as unborn and enters into certainty about reality.

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: ” He asked, “Mañjuśrī,

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba de gang la bya /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba de gang la bya /
translated: what is meant by ‘certainty about reality’?

original: smras pa / bdag dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mtshungs te /
analyzed: smras pa / bdag dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mtshungs te /
translated: ” He replied, “Self and nirvāṇa are the same.

original: 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med de /
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med de /
translated: This is non-dual and cannot be made dual.

original: de bas na yang dag pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya'o //🔽yang dag par nyid du zhugs pas na de'i phyir yang dag par nges pa zhe bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya'o // yang dag par nyid du zhugs pas na de'i phyir yang dag par nges pa zhe bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‘definite in reality.’🔽Because one has entered into reality, therefore it is called ‘definite in reality.’

original: mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid la nges par byung bas na de'i phyir yang dag par nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid la nges par byung bas na de'i phyir yang dag par nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because one has emerged from equality into equality, therefore it is called ‘definite in reality.’

original: nges pa'i don la don 'dren pas na de'i phyir yang dag par nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i don la don 'dren pas na de'i phyir yang dag par nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because one has brought the meaning into the definitive meaning, therefore it is called ‘definite in reality.’

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la sgro btags pa med pa'i phyir de ni yang dag par nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la sgro btags pa med pa'i phyir de ni yang dag par nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is not a superimposition on any samādhi, therefore it is called ‘definite in reality.’

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, “Excellent!

original: 'jam dpal / khyod kyi tshig 'di legs par smras te ji ltar @110a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod kyi tshig 'di legs par smras te ji ltar @110a *//
translated: Mañjuśrī, you have spoken well.

original: ston pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: ston pa de de bzhin no //
translated: It is just as you have taught.

original: khyod kyis bstan pa 'di bshad pa na dge slong bdun stong len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: khyod kyis bstan pa 'di bshad pa na dge slong bdun stong len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: When you explained this teaching, the minds of seven thousand monks were liberated from contaminants with no further grasping.”

original: lha'i bu stong phrag sum cu rtsa gnyis chos rnams la mig rdul med cing rdul dang bral ba'i chos kyi mig skyes so //
analyzed: lha'i bu stong phrag sum cu rtsa gnyis chos rnams la mig rdul med cing rdul dang bral ba'i chos kyi mig skyes so //
translated: Thirty-two thousand gods gave rise to the eye of Dharma, free of dust and stainless, with regard to phenomena.

original: srog chags stong phrag bcu 'dod chags dang bral ba thob bo //
analyzed: srog chags stong phrag bcu 'dod chags dang bral ba thob bo //
translated: Ten thousand beings attained freedom from desire.

original: srog chags nyis brgya bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
analyzed: srog chags nyis brgya bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: Two hundred beings gave rise to the mind of unexcelled and perfect awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lnga stong mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skyes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lnga stong mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skyes so //
translated: Five thousand bodhisattvas gave rise to acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pa khyad par sems kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pa khyad par sems kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Brahma Viśeṣacintin said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur bas sangs rgyas kyi bgyi ba bgyis so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur bas sangs rgyas kyi bgyi ba bgyis so //
translated: Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta has accomplished the deeds of a buddha.

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /🔽tshangs pa / sangs rgyas 'byung ba gang la'ang phan pa'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa / tshangs pa / sangs rgyas 'byung ba gang la'ang phan pa'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: gnod par nye bar mi gnas so //
analyzed: gnod par nye bar mi gnas so //
translated: “Brahmā, the appearance of a buddha is neither beneficial nor harmful.🔽”

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: “Mañjuśrī,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshad med pa'i sems can yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshad med pa'i sems can yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
translated: The Blessed One has brought to nirvana countless beings.

original: khyod kyang tshad med pa'i sems can yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: khyod kyang tshad med pa'i sems can yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: And you, too, are bringing countless beings to nirvana, are you not?

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa /
translated: He replied, “Brahmā,

original: sems can med pa la sems can du rab tu 'byed par 'dod dam /
analyzed: sems can med pa la sems can du rab tu 'byed par 'dod dam /
translated: do you wish to distinguish beings from the absence of beings?

original: smras pa / de ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / de ma yin no //
translated: ” He replied, “No, I do not.

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /🔽sems can med pa la sems can du bstan pa'am /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa / sems can med pa la sems can du bstan pa'am /
translated: ” Mañjuśrī said, “Brahmā,🔽do you wish to teach beings as being absent of beings,

original: sems can med pa la sems @110b can yongs su grub par 'dod dam /
analyzed: sems can med pa la sems @110b can yongs su grub par 'dod dam /
translated: or do you wish to establish beings as being absent of beings?

original: smras pa / de ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / de ma yin no //
translated: ” He replied, “No, I do not.

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'am /
translated: ” Mañjuśrī said, “Brahmā,

original: 'gag par 'dod dam /
analyzed: 'gag par 'dod dam /
translated: do you wish for the Thus-Gone One to appear or cease?

original: smras pa / ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin no //
translated: ” He replied, “No, I do not.🔽” Mañjuśrī said, “Brahmā,

original: smras pa / de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems can de dag gang yin /
analyzed: smras pa / de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems can de dag gang yin /
translated: what are those beings who have attained complete nirvāṇa through the Thus-Gone One?

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa /
translated: ” He replied, “Mañjuśrī, youthful Mañjuśrī,

original: chos kyi tshul gyi rnam pa gang gis ston pa ltar na 'di la 'khor ba'ang med /
analyzed: chos kyi tshul gyi rnam pa gang gis ston pa ltar na 'di la 'khor ba'ang med /
translated: “Brahmā, according to the way things are taught in the Dharma, there is no saṃsāra

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang med do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang med do //
translated: and there is no nirvāṇa.”

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa /
translated: Brahmā said, “Mañjuśrī,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is just as you have said.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba'ang ma dmigs /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba'ang ma dmigs /
translated: The Tathāgata does not apprehend saṃsāra

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'ang ma dmigs so //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'ang ma dmigs so //
translated: and he does not apprehend nirvāṇa.

original: tshangs pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis gang nyan thos btul ba de dag gis kyang 'khor ba'ang ma dmigs /
analyzed: tshangs pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis gang nyan thos btul ba de dag gis kyang 'khor ba'ang ma dmigs /
translated: Brahmā, those disciples of the Blessed One who are trained do not apprehend saṃsāra

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang ma dmigs so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang ma dmigs so //
translated: and they do not apprehend nirvāṇa.

original: tshangs pa / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba 'di ni btags pa'i tshig tha snyad tsam ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba 'di ni btags pa'i tshig tha snyad tsam ste /
translated: Brahmā, ‘nirvāṇa’ is a term that is a mere designation and convention.

original: 'di la gang yang 'khor ba'ang med do //
analyzed: 'di la gang yang 'khor ba'ang med do //
translated: There is no saṃsāra here

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'ang med do //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'ang med do //
translated: and there is no nirvāṇa.”

original: smras pa; 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa; 'jam dpal /
translated: Brahmā said, “Mañjuśrī,

original: 'di la su dag dad par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di la su dag dad par 'gyur /
translated: who will have faith in this?”

original: smras pa / chos gang la'ang mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ba rnams so //
analyzed: smras pa / chos gang la'ang mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ba rnams so //
translated: Mañjuśrī said, “Those who do not become attached to any phenomenon.”

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: Brahmā said, “Mañjuśrī,

original: mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba de ci la mngon par chags /
analyzed: mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba de ci la mngon par chags /
translated: What is it that is attached to?

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa /
translated: Vimalakīrti replied, “Brahmā,

original: mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba ni med pa la mngon par chags so //🔽gal te / tshangs pa /
analyzed: mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba ni med pa la mngon par chags so // gal te / tshangs pa /
translated: ‘attachment’ is attached to nonexistence.🔽Brahmā,

original: yod pa la mngon par @111a *//
analyzed: yod pa la mngon par @111a *//
translated: if there were any existent thing to which one might become attached,

original: chags par gyur na 'di ltar shin tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral bar gyur pa ma yin no //🔽'di ltar med pa la mngon par chags pa ste /
analyzed: chags par gyur na 'di ltar shin tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral bar gyur pa ma yin no // 'di ltar med pa la mngon par chags pa ste /
translated: then one would not be free from pride.🔽But since there is no existent thing to which one might become attached,

original: de bas na med pa'o zhes rtogs nas mngon par chags par mi byed de /🔽gang mngon par chags pa mi byed pa de mi 'khor ro //
analyzed: de bas na med pa'o zhes rtogs nas mngon par chags par mi byed de / gang mngon par chags pa mi byed pa de mi 'khor ro //
translated: one should not become attached to the notion that there is nonexistence.🔽One who does not become attached does not revolve in cyclic existence.

original: gang mi 'khor ba de rnam par mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gang mi 'khor ba de rnam par mi 'gro ba'o //
translated: One who does not revolve in cyclic existence does not transmigrate.

original: gang rnam par mi 'gro ba de mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang rnam par mi 'gro ba de mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who does not transmigrate is said to be liberated.🔽”

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: Brahmā said, “Mañjuśrī,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ci'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ci'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya /
translated: why is it called ‘liberation’?🔽”

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied, “Brahmā,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun rkyen la sgro mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun rkyen la sgro mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‘Complete nirvāṇa’ means not superimposing conditions on each other.

original: ma rig pa mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / 'du byed mi 'jug pas kyang nye bar mi sbyor te /
analyzed: ma rig pa mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / 'du byed mi 'jug pas kyang nye bar mi sbyor te /
translated: Ignorance does not form, and formations do not engage, so they do not connect.

original: gang nye bar mi sbyor ba de ni kun nas mi slong ngo //
analyzed: gang nye bar mi sbyor ba de ni kun nas mi slong ngo //
translated: That which does not connect does not activate.

original: gang kun nas mi slong ba de ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang kun nas mi slong ba de ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which does not activate is said to be completely nirvāṇa.

original: kun nas mi slong ba spyod pa ni shin tu 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas mi slong ba spyod pa ni shin tu 'gog pa'o //
translated: The practice of non-activation is complete cessation.

original: de'i lam mngon par rtogs pa ni shin tu mi skye ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i lam mngon par rtogs pa ni shin tu mi skye ba yin te /
translated: The realization of its path is complete non-arising.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the four noble truths.

original: de nas bram ze shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i bu mnyam par gnas pas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas bram ze shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i bu mnyam par gnas pas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the brahmin youth Samantabhadra said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:

original: 'jam dpal / khyod kyis bstan pa thams cad ni yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod kyis bstan pa thams cad ni yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, all your teachings are correct teachings.

original: smras pa / rigs @111b kyi bu tshig thams cad ni yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / rigs @111b kyi bu tshig thams cad ni yang dag pa'o //
translated: Vimalakīrti replied, “Noble sir, all words are true.🔽”

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī said, “Vimalakīrti,

original: gang rdzun gyi tshig yod pa ma yin pa yang dag par ma yin pa de yang dag pa'am /
analyzed: gang rdzun gyi tshig yod pa ma yin pa yang dag par ma yin pa de yang dag pa'am /
translated: is the word of one who is not lying and is not mistaken really true?🔽”

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Vimalakīrti replied, “Noble sir,🔽that is also true.

original: de yang yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa'o //
translated: It is also real.🔽

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Mañjuśrī asked, “Why is that true?🔽”

original: 'di ltar ngag thams cad ni dbang du gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngag thams cad ni dbang du gyur ba ste /
translated: Vimalakīrti replied, “Because all speech is controlled,

original: yul la gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: yul la gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: and does not dwell on objects.

original: phyogs na gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs na gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: It does not dwell in the directions.

original: gang dbang du gyur cing yul la'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: gang dbang du gyur cing yul la'ang mi gnas /
translated: That which is controlled, and does not dwell on objects,

original: phyogs la'ang mi gnas pa de ni med pa'i phyir yang dag pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs la'ang mi gnas pa de ni med pa'i phyir yang dag pa ste /
translated: and does not dwell in the directions, is nonexistent, and therefore it is true.

original: de'i phyir tshig thams cad kyang yang dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig thams cad kyang yang dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all words are said to be true.

original: gang yang lha sbyin gyis tshig smras pa dang / gang de bzhin gshegs pas tshig smras pa tshig de gnyis tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang lha sbyin gyis tshig smras pa dang / gang de bzhin gshegs pas tshig smras pa tshig de gnyis tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, the words spoken by Devadatta and the words spoken by the Tathāgata are not two.🔽”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Mañjuśrī asked, “Why is that?

original: tshig thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: tshig thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig ste /
translated: All words are the words of the Tathagata.

original: tshig thams cad ni de bzhin nyid las mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: tshig thams cad ni de bzhin nyid las mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: All words do not go beyond reality.

original: gang tshig gi rnam par rig par byas pa ste thams cad ni rnam par rig pa med pas rnam par rig par byas ba ste /
analyzed: gang tshig gi rnam par rig par byas pa ste thams cad ni rnam par rig pa med pas rnam par rig par byas ba ste /
translated: All words are made known through the knowledge of words, but they are made known through the absence of knowledge.

original: de bas na tshig thams cad yi ge mnyam pa'i phyir /🔽yi ge mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na tshig thams cad yi ge mnyam pa'i phyir / yi ge mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, all words are the same because of the sameness of letters.🔽All words are the same because of the sameness of letters.

original: yi ge stong pa'i phyir tshig thams cad ni mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge stong pa'i phyir tshig thams cad ni mtshungs pa'o //
translated: All words are the same because of the emptiness of letters.

original: mnyam par gnas pas smras pa /
analyzed: mnyam par gnas pas smras pa /
translated: Samantabhadra said,

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pas 'phags pa'i tha snyad du 'dogs pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad du 'dogs pa zhes ma gsungs sam /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pas 'phags pa'i tha snyad du 'dogs pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad du 'dogs pa zhes ma gsungs sam /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, didn’t the Tathāgata say that there are two kinds of conventions: the conventions of the noble ones and the conventions of the non-noble ones?”🔽Mañjuśrī replied,

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /🔽yi ge gang dag gis 'phags pa rnams kyi tha snyad du 'dogs @112a *//
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu / yi ge gang dag gis 'phags pa rnams kyi tha snyad du 'dogs @112a *//
translated: “Noble sir,🔽the same letters that are used by the noble ones🔽to make conventions

original: pa'i yi ge de dag nyid kyis 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyang tha snyad du 'dogs so //
analyzed: pa'i yi ge de dag nyid kyis 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyang tha snyad du 'dogs so //
translated: are also used by the non-noble ones to make conventions.

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: Vimalakīrti replied, “Mañjuśrī,

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: it is so!

original: smras pa / ci yi ge de dag 'phags pa'am /🔽'phags pa ma yin pa zhes rtog gam /
analyzed: smras pa / ci yi ge de dag 'phags pa'am / 'phags pa ma yin pa zhes rtog gam /
translated: ” Mañjuśrī continued, “Are those letters noble or not?🔽”

original: smras pa / de ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / de ma yin no //
translated: Vimalakīrti replied, “No, Mañjuśrī, they are not.🔽” Mañjuśrī continued, “Just as those letters are neither noble nor ignoble, so all things are beyond the perceptions of noble and ignoble.

original: smras pa / ji ltar yi ge de dag mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa de bzhin du 'phags pa rnams ni rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //🔽de dag la tha snyad med de /
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar yi ge de dag mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa de bzhin du 'phags pa rnams ni rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'o // de dag la tha snyad med de /
translated: They are beyond the conventions of noble and ignoble.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni yi ger 'du shes pas tha snyad du mi 'dogs so //🔽chos su 'du shes pas ma yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni yi ger 'du shes pas tha snyad du mi 'dogs so // chos su 'du shes pas ma yin /
translated: The noble ones do not make conventional distinctions on the basis of the notion of letters.

original: chos ma yin par 'du shes pas ma yin /🔽bdag tu 'du shes pas ma yin /
analyzed: chos ma yin par 'du shes pas ma yin / bdag tu 'du shes pas ma yin /
translated: They do not make conventional distinctions on the basis of the notion of phenomena or of non-phenomena.

original: pha rol tu 'du shes pas ma yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu 'du shes pas ma yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
translated: They do not make conventional distinctions on the basis of the notion of self or of other.🔽They do not make conventional distinctions on the basis of the notion of Dharma or non-Dharma.🔽They do not make conventional distinctions on the basis of the notion of noble or ignoble.

original: dper na / sil snyan dang / rnga bo che dang / rdza rnga dang / dung dag ni rkyen gyis sgra 'byung yang de dag rnam par mi rtog pa de bzhin du 'phags pa rnams rkyen kun 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir tha snyad du 'dogs pas chags par mi byed /
analyzed: dper na / sil snyan dang / rnga bo che dang / rdza rnga dang / dung dag ni rkyen gyis sgra 'byung yang de dag rnam par mi rtog pa de bzhin du 'phags pa rnams rkyen kun 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir tha snyad du 'dogs pas chags par mi byed /
translated: In the same way, the noble ones, because they see the arising of conditions, do not become attached to conventional designations,

original: mngon par chas par mi byed do //
analyzed: mngon par chas par mi byed do //
translated: and do not become fixated on them.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' mnyam par gnas kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' mnyam par gnas kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Samantabhadra said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta,

original: 'jam dpal / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ltar dge slong dag 'dus te 'khod pas bya ba gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ltar dge slong dag 'dus te 'khod pas bya ba gnyis yod de /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, the Blessed One has said, ‘Monks, when you gather together, there are two things you should do:

original: chos kyi gtam bya ba dang / 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pas gnas par @112b bya'o zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: chos kyi gtam bya ba dang / 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pas gnas par @112b bya'o zhes gsungs na /
translated: either have a discussion about the Dharma, or maintain the noble silence.’

original: de la / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: de la / 'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: chos kyi gtam ni gang /
analyzed: chos kyi gtam ni gang /
translated: what is a discussion about the Dharma?

original: 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa ni gang /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa ni gang /
translated: What is the noble silence?”

original: smras pa / gtam gang gis sangs rgyas 'khrug par mi byed /
analyzed: smras pa / gtam gang gis sangs rgyas 'khrug par mi byed /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied, “A discussion is any discussion that does not disturb the buddhas.

original: chos 'khrug par mi byed /
analyzed: chos 'khrug par mi byed /
translated: He does not cause conflict in the Dharma.

original: dge 'dun 'khrug par mi byed pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo //
analyzed: dge 'dun 'khrug par mi byed pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo //
translated: He does not cause conflict in the Saṅgha. This is the Dharma discourse.

original: sangs rgyas la chos nyid du mos pa dang / chos la 'dod chags dang bral bar mos pa dang / dge 'dun la 'dus ma byas su mos pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la chos nyid du mos pa dang / chos la 'dod chags dang bral bar mos pa dang / dge 'dun la 'dus ma byas su mos pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
translated: He is devoted to the Buddha as the nature of phenomena, devoted to the Dharma as free from desire, and devoted to the Saṅgha as unconditioned. This is the noble silence.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la brtsams te gtam brjod pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la brtsams te gtam brjod pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo //
translated: the discourse that begins with the four establishments of mindfulness is the Dharma discourse.

original: yang chos thams cad la ma dran zhing yid la mi byed pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang chos thams cad la ma dran zhing yid la mi byed pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The non-attention and non-mentation of all phenomena is the noble silence.

original: gang yang dag par spong ba bzhi la brtsams te gtam brjod pa ni chos kyi gtam mo //
analyzed: gang yang dag par spong ba bzhi la brtsams te gtam brjod pa ni chos kyi gtam mo //
translated: The discourse that begins with the four right efforts is the Dharma discourse.

original: gang mnyam pa nyid kyis mtshungs par yang mi byed /
analyzed: gang mnyam pa nyid kyis mtshungs par yang mi byed /
translated: He does not make them equal through sameness,

original: mi mtshungs par yang mi byed pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi mtshungs par yang mi byed pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
translated: nor does he make them unequal. This is the noble silence.

original: gang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la brtsams te gtam brjod pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo //
analyzed: gang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la brtsams te gtam brjod pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo //
translated: The Dharma discourse is the discourse that begins with the four bases of supernatural powers.

original: gang lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi brtson par mi byed pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi brtson par mi byed pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The noble silence is the silence of one who does not exert himself in body, speech, and mind.

original: gang dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga la brtsams te gtam brjod pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo //🔽gang su la'ang dad pas chos gang la'ang dad par yang mi byed cing chos thams cad la'ang blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par rab tu rnam @113a *//
analyzed: gang dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga la brtsams te gtam brjod pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo // gang su la'ang dad pas chos gang la'ang dad par yang mi byed cing chos thams cad la'ang blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par rab tu rnam @113a *//
translated: The Dharma discourse is the discourse that begins with the five faculties and the five powers.

original: par 'byed pa de ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: par 'byed pa de ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur ba'o //
translated: The noble silence is the silence of one who, with regard to anything, does not believe in anything through faith, but who discerns all things without accepting or rejecting them.

original: dran pa dang / rtse gcig pa dang / rlom sems med pa la gnas shing chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mnyam par bzhag par mos pa dang / spros pa'i gnas thams cad la mi rten pa'i rkyen du gyur pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang / rtse gcig pa dang / rlom sems med pa la gnas shing chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mnyam par bzhag par mos pa dang / spros pa'i gnas thams cad la mi rten pa'i rkyen du gyur pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
translated: It is to be absorbed in the natural equipoise of all phenomena, while remaining in mindfulness, one-pointedness, and the absence of conceit. It is to be the condition for not relying on any basis of conceptual elaboration. This is the noble silence.

original: gang byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la brtsams te gtam brjod pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo //🔽gang btang snyoms pas sgro btags pa med pa 'thob cing bsal pa'ang med /
analyzed: gang byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la brtsams te gtam brjod pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo // gang btang snyoms pas sgro btags pa med pa 'thob cing bsal pa'ang med /
translated: “To speak about the seven factors of awakening is Dharma discourse.

original: bzhag pa'ang med par gnas pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bzhag pa'ang med par gnas pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
translated: It is to attain the absence of exaggeration through equanimity, and to remain without dispelling or establishing anything. This is the noble silence.

original: gang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa las brtsams te gtam rjod par byed pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo //
analyzed: gang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa las brtsams te gtam rjod par byed pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo //
translated: “To speak about the eightfold path of the noble ones is Dharma discourse.

original: gang gzings lta bur rtogs nas chos la'ang mi rten /
analyzed: gang gzings lta bur rtogs nas chos la'ang mi rten /
translated: It is to realize that one should be like a raft and not rely on either the Dharma or what is not the Dharma.

original: chos ma yin pa la'ang mi rten par gnas pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa la'ang mi rten par gnas pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
translated: This is the noble silence.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos 'di dag smra ba dang / 'chad pa dang / ston pa dang / 'dogs pa dang / 'jug par byed pa dang / 'grel pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed cing yang dag par ji lta bur ston pa gang yin pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos 'di dag smra ba dang / 'chad pa dang / ston pa dang / 'dogs pa dang / 'jug par byed pa dang / 'grel pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed cing yang dag par ji lta bur ston pa gang yin pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo //
translated: this is the Dharma discourse that explains, teaches, demonstrates, establishes, reveals, elucidates, and perfectly reveals just as it is these thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: gang 'di ltar chos kyis mngon sum du gyur la lus las logs shig na'ang @113b chos mi mthong /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar chos kyis mngon sum du gyur la lus las logs shig na'ang @113b chos mi mthong /
translated: In this way, the Dharma is directly perceived, but the body is not seen as separate from the Dharma.

original: chos las logs shig na'ang lus mi mthong /🔽ji nas gnyis su'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: chos las logs shig na'ang lus mi mthong / ji nas gnyis su'ang mi mthong /
translated: The Dharma is not seen as separate from the body.🔽One does not see it as dual,

original: gnyis med par yang mi mthong ba de ltar mthong ste /
analyzed: gnyis med par yang mi mthong ba de ltar mthong ste /
translated: nor does one see it as nondual.

original: de ltar mthong nas mngon sum du ye shes mthong ba'ang mi mthong ste /
analyzed: de ltar mthong nas mngon sum du ye shes mthong ba'ang mi mthong ste /
translated: Seeing in this way, one does not see even the direct perception of wisdom.

original: gang mi mthong ba 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang mi mthong ba 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Not seeing anything, one becomes an ārya who is silent.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: gang bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa dang / pha rol tu sgro 'dogs pa dang / chos su sgro 'dogs pa dang / chos ma yin par sgro 'dogs pas gtam mi brjod pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo //
analyzed: gang bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa dang / pha rol tu sgro 'dogs pa dang / chos su sgro 'dogs pa dang / chos ma yin par sgro 'dogs pas gtam mi brjod pa 'di ni chos kyi gtam mo //
translated: The Dharma discourse is that which does not speak with the superimposition of self, other, dharma, or non-dharma.

original: gang brjod du med pa'i chos nyid thob pas yi ge dang / skad dang / sgra dang / dbyangs thams cad dang bral ba mi g-yo ba thob pa dben pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems kyis nye bar bsgrub pa la gnas pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang brjod du med pa'i chos nyid thob pas yi ge dang / skad dang / sgra dang / dbyangs thams cad dang bral ba mi g-yo ba thob pa dben pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems kyis nye bar bsgrub pa la gnas pa 'di ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The noble silence is the attainment of the immovable, free from all letters, speech, sounds, and tones, by attaining the inexpressible intrinsic nature, abiding in the accomplishment of the mind's intrinsic nature of seclusion.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gang su dag sems can thams cad kyi dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa shes pas gtam brjod pa de dag ni chos kyi gtam brjod pa'o gang la la mnyam par bzhag cing ma g-yeng pa de dag ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang su dag sems can thams cad kyi dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa shes pas gtam brjod pa de dag ni chos kyi gtam brjod pa'o gang la la mnyam par bzhag cing ma g-yeng pa de dag ni 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: those who speak with the knowledge of the superior and inferior faculties of all sentient beings speak the Dharma discourse. Those who are in equipoise and undistracted abide in the noble silence.

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bram ze shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i bu mnyam par gnas pas 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bram ze shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i bu mnyam par gnas pas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then, the brahmin youth Samantabhadra, the son of the great Śālavṛkṣa, said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:

original: ji ltar / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: ji ltar / 'jam dpal /
translated: “Mañjuśrī,

original: khyod kyis bshad pa'i don kho bos shes pa ltar na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams @114a *//
analyzed: khyod kyis bshad pa'i don kho bos shes pa ltar na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams @114a *//
translated: according to the meaning of what you have said, I understand that śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: la chos kyi gtam dang / 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa med do //
analyzed: la chos kyi gtam dang / 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa med do //
translated: do not have Dharma discourses and do not abide in noble silence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin par shes pa la mkhas pa'ang med /
analyzed: de dag dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin par shes pa la mkhas pa'ang med /
translated: They do not have the skill to know which faculties are supreme and which are not supreme,

original: rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: and they are not always in meditative equipoise.

original: 'jam dpal / su dag chos smra ba yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / su dag chos smra ba yin /
translated: Mañjuśrī, who are the ones who speak the Dharma?

original: su dag 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa la gnas pa yin zhes gang yang dag par smra bas smra na /
analyzed: su dag 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa la gnas pa yin zhes gang yang dag par smra bas smra na /
translated: Who are the ones who abide in noble silence?”

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes yang dag par smra bas smra'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes yang dag par smra bas smra'o //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata is the one who speaks the Dharma correctly.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni sems can thams cad kyi dbang po la mkhas shing rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni sems can thams cad kyi dbang po la mkhas shing rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa'o //
translated: The Buddha Bhagavat is skilled in the faculties of all sentient beings and is always in equipoise.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Bhagavat said to Manjushri Kumara:

original: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu mnyam par gnas pas ji ltar bshad pa de de bzhin te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu mnyam par gnas pas ji ltar bshad pa de de bzhin te /
translated: Manjushri, the son of family who abides in equipoise, what you have said is so.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dgongs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dgongs so //
translated: In this way, the Buddha Bhagavats have realized it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the elder Subhuti said this to the Bhagavat:

original: bcom ldan 'das las bdag gis mngon sum du thos shing mngon sum du bzung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las bdag gis mngon sum du thos shing mngon sum du bzung ste /
translated: Bhagavat, I have directly heard and directly understood from the Bhagavat that

original: dge slong 'dus te 'khod pa rnams kyis bya ba gnyis yod de /
analyzed: dge slong 'dus te 'khod pa rnams kyis bya ba gnyis yod de /
translated: when the assembly of monks gathers, there are two things to be done:

original: chos kyi gtam brjod pa la bya /
analyzed: chos kyi gtam brjod pa la bya /
translated: to speak about the Dharma,

original: 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa la gnas par bya'o zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa la gnas par bya'o zhes gsungs na /
translated: or to abide in noble silence.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavat,

original: @114b gal te gnas 'di la nyan thos rnams mi nus na de ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas nyan thos rnams la chos kyi gtam brjod cig /
analyzed: @114b gal te gnas 'di la nyan thos rnams mi nus na de ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas nyan thos rnams la chos kyi gtam brjod cig /
translated: If the śrāvakas are incapable of this topic, then how could the Tathāgata have given a Dharma discourse to the śrāvakas?

original: yang na 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pas gnas par byos shig ces don 'di nye bar bstan /
analyzed: yang na 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pas gnas par byos shig ces don 'di nye bar bstan /
translated: Or else, the noble ones should remain in silence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ci snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ci snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: nyan thos rnams ma thos par chos kyi gtam brjod dam /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ma thos par chos kyi gtam brjod dam /
translated: Did the śrāvakas give a Dharma discourse without hearing it?

original: 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa rtse gcig pas gnas sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi smra bar gyur pa rtse gcig pas gnas sam /
translated: Or did the noble ones remain in silence with one-pointed focus?”

original: gsol pa / de ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / de ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / rnam grangs 'dis 'di ltar nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la chos kyi gtam yang med /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / rnam grangs 'dis 'di ltar nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la chos kyi gtam yang med /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'phags pa mi smra ba'ang med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa mi smra ba'ang med par rig par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, by this one of many explanations, it should be understood that the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas have neither a Dharma discourse nor noble silence.”🔽Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said to the venerable Subhūti,

analyzed: byang chub kyang gzhan la mya ngan las 'das pa'ang gzhan no zhes smon par bgyid na byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni byang chub la spyod pa ma lags so // de nas tshangs pa khyad par sems kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: If they were to aspire to enlightenment and nirvāṇa as being different, then those bodhisattvas would not be practicing for enlightenment.

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar spyod na byang chub la spyod pa yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar spyod na byang chub la spyod pa yin /
translated: Then Brahma­viśeṣacintin said to Mañjuśrī­kumārabhūta, “Mañjuśrī, how do bodhisattvas practice in order to practice for enlightenment?”

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied, “Brahmā,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang chos thams @128b cad la'ang spyod la chos gang la'ang mi spyod na byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub la spyod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang chos thams @128b cad la'ang spyod la chos gang la'ang mi spyod na byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub la spyod de /
translated: if bodhisattvas practice all phenomena but do not practice any phenomena, then those bodhisattvas practice for enlightenment.

original: tshangs pa / spyod pa yul las 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub tu spyod de; ;smras pa /
analyzed: tshangs pa / spyod pa yul las 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub tu spyod de; ;smras pa /
translated: Brahmā, bodhisattvas who transcend the domain of practice practice for enlightenment.”

original: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa'i yul las 'das pa byang chub la spyod //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa'i yul las 'das pa byang chub la spyod //
translated: Viśeṣacintin asked, “Mañjuśrī, how do bodhisattvas who transcend the domain of practice practice for enlightenment?”

original: smras pa / dmigs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral zhing /
analyzed: smras pa / dmigs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral zhing /
translated: He replied, “It is free from all signs of conceptualization.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang bral ba de ltar na spyad pa'i yul thams cad las shin tu 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang bral ba de ltar na spyad pa'i yul thams cad las shin tu 'das pa yin no //
translated: It is free from eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind. In this way, it transcends all objects of engagement.

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: ” He asked, “Mañjuśrī,

original: yang dag par 'das ba zhes bya ba ci la bsam /
analyzed: yang dag par 'das ba zhes bya ba ci la bsam /
translated: what do you think of when you say ‘transcendence’?

original: smras pa / mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa / mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: ” He replied, “It is not transcending equality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshangs pa / byang chub ni chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshangs pa / byang chub ni chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Brahmā, awakening is the equality of all phenomena.

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpas ji ltar na byang chub tu 'jug par bya /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpas ji ltar na byang chub tu 'jug par bya /
translated: ” He asked, “Mañjuśrī, how should bodhisattvas engage with awakening?

original: smras pa / byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: smras pa / byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: ” He replied, “Just as awakening is.

original: smras pa / byang chub ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: smras pa / byang chub ji lta bu yin /
translated: ” He asked, “What is awakening like?

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa /
translated: ” He replied, “Brahmā,

original: byang chub de ni 'das pa'ang ma yin /🔽ma 'ongs pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: byang chub de ni 'das pa'ang ma yin / ma 'ongs pa'ang ma yin /
translated: awakening is not past,🔽not future,

original: da ltar byung ba'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'ang ma yin te /
translated: and not present.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpas dus gsum yongs su dag pa'i rnam pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub tu yang dag 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpas dus gsum yongs su dag pa'i rnam pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub tu yang dag 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva should enter into enlightenment with the aspect of the purity of the three times and with the purity of the three spheres.

original: 'das pa ji lta ba dang / ma 'ongs pa ji lta ba dang / da ltar byung ba ji lta ba dang / ma byung ba ji lta ba dang / ma byung ba gang yin @129a *//
analyzed: 'das pa ji lta ba dang / ma 'ongs pa ji lta ba dang / da ltar byung ba ji lta ba dang / ma byung ba ji lta ba dang / ma byung ba gang yin @129a *//
translated: As it is in the past, as it is in the future, as it is in the present, as it is in the unarisen,

original: pa de la rab tu dbye ba med de /
analyzed: pa de la rab tu dbye ba med de /
translated: in that there is no differentiation.

original: gang de ltar rab tu zhugs pa de gang la'ang zhugs pa med do //
analyzed: gang de ltar rab tu zhugs pa de gang la'ang zhugs pa med do //
translated: One who enters in that way does not enter into anything at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab tu 'jug pa 'dis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pa 'dis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this entry, one attains the wisdom of omniscience.🔽”

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: “Mañjuśrī,

original: ci'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya /
translated: why is it called the wisdom of omniscience?🔽”

original: smras pa / thams cad shes par gyur ba'i ye shes de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad shes par gyur ba'i ye shes de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: “That wisdom which has become omniscient is called the wisdom of omniscience.🔽”

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: “Mañjuśrī,

original: kun shes pa gang yin /
analyzed: kun shes pa gang yin /
translated: what is omniscience?

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa /
translated: Vimalakīrti replied, “Brahmā,

original: kun shes pa gang la dngos po med cing kun shes pa la kun shes pa med pa de ni kun shes pa ste /
analyzed: kun shes pa gang la dngos po med cing kun shes pa la kun shes pa med pa de ni kun shes pa ste /
translated: that which is called ‘perfect knowledge’ is not a thing, and in perfect knowledge there is no perfect knowledge.

original: dngos po ji lta ba de bzhin du de'i kun shes pa'ang med do //
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba de bzhin du de'i kun shes pa'ang med do //
translated: Just as a thing does not exist, so also perfect knowledge does not exist.

original: smras pa / ci'i phyir dngos po med /
analyzed: smras pa / ci'i phyir dngos po med /
translated: ” Brahmā said, “Why is it that a thing does not exist?

original: smras pa / dngos po ni ming gi rang bzhin gyis dpen te; de'i ming dang / rang bzhin dben la dngos po'ang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po ni ming gi rang bzhin gyis dpen te; de'i ming dang / rang bzhin dben la dngos po'ang gzhan ma yin /
translated: ” Vimalakīrti replied, “A thing is isolated in its intrinsic nature, and its intrinsic nature is isolated. A thing is not one thing and its intrinsic nature another.

original: byang chub kyang gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyang gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Enlightenment is not one thing and a thing another.

original: gal te dngos po'ang gzhan la byang chub kyang gzhan du zin na 'di ltar 'di la byang chub ji lta bar dngos po'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te dngos po'ang gzhan la byang chub kyang gzhan du zin na 'di ltar 'di la byang chub ji lta bar dngos po'ang de bzhin no //
translated: If a thing were one thing and enlightenment another, then enlightenment would not be the essence of a thing.🔽Therefore, Brahmā, a thing is not one thing and enlightenment another.

original: de lta bas na 'di la sems can yang gud na med la de rnam pa gzhan du'ang rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di la sems can yang gud na med la de rnam pa gzhan du'ang rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, Brahmā, there is no other enlightenment apart from the essential nature of a thing, and there is no other essential nature of a thing apart from enlightenment.

original: gzhan du na bdag gi mnyam pa nyid kyis byang chub mnyam pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis bdag gi mnyam pa nyid rig par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan du na bdag gi mnyam pa nyid kyis byang chub mnyam pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis bdag gi mnyam pa nyid rig par byed de /
translated: Otherwise, one would know the sameness of the self through the sameness of enlightenment, and one would know the sameness of enlightenment through the sameness of the self.

original: de ltar na byang chub rtogs par @129b 'gyur te gzhan du ma yin pas na de'i phyir de la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub rtogs par @129b 'gyur te gzhan du ma yin pas na de'i phyir de la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Thus, one would realize enlightenment, and not otherwise. Therefore, there is no change in it.

original: bdag ni rtag tu bdag med pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni rtag tu bdag med pa yin te /
translated: The self is always selfless.

original: de phyir de la rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de phyir de la rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no change in it.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad la'ang gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //🔽de nas tshangs pa khyad par sems kyis 'jam dpal gzhol nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad la'ang gzhan du 'gyur ba med do // de nas tshangs pa khyad par sems kyis 'jam dpal gzhol nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Just as there is no change in space, so there is no change in any phenomena.

original: 'di ltar chos 'di dag rab tu phye ba las na de bzhin gshegs pa ni bden par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos 'di dag rab tu phye ba las na de bzhin gshegs pa ni bden par gsungs pa'o //
translated: Then Brahmaviśeṣacinti asked Mañjuśrī, “Since these phenomena are distinguished in this way, the Tathāgata is said to speak the truth.”

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied, “Brahmā,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos gang yang rab tu ma phye'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos gang yang rab tu ma phye'o //
translated: The Thus-Gone One has not revealed any phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos nyid kyang ma dmigs na gang rab tu dbye ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos nyid kyang ma dmigs na gang rab tu dbye ba lta ci smos /
translated: Since the Thus-Gone One does not even observe the nature of phenomena, what need is there to mention revealing it?

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: ci de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di dag ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: ci de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di dag ni 'dus byas so //
translated: have the Thus-Gone One not distinguished these phenomena as follows: ‘These phenomena are conditioned,

original: chos 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas so //
translated: these phenomena are unconditioned,

original: chos 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: these phenomena are mundane,

original: chos 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o zhes chos rnams rnam par mi mkhyen tam; smras pa /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o zhes chos rnams rnam par mi mkhyen tam; smras pa /
translated: and these phenomena are supramundane’?

original: tshangs pa / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽sus kyang nam mkha' 'di rab tu phye ba'am /
analyzed: tshangs pa / 'di ji snyam du sems / sus kyang nam mkha' 'di rab tu phye ba'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied, “Brahmā, what do you think?

original: shes par gyur ba yod dam /🔽smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: shes par gyur ba yod dam / smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: Is there anyone who has revealed or understood space?”

original: de ma yin no //
analyzed: de ma yin no //
translated: Mañjuśrī replied, “No, Brahmā, there is not.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /🔽gang nam mkha' zhes bya ba de skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa / gang nam mkha' zhes bya ba de skye ba'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī asked, “Brahmā,

original: 'gag par 'gyur ram /🔽smras pa / de ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur ram / smras pa / de ma yin no //
translated: does what is called ‘space’ arise or cease?”

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied, “No, it does not.”🔽Mañjuśrī asked, “Brahmā,

original: de bzhin du chos gang yang rung ba'i rnam par rig @130a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du chos gang yang rung ba'i rnam par rig @130a *//
translated: Likewise, it is the cognition of any phenomenon whatsoever.🔽

original: par byed pa de'ang nam mkha' rnam par rig par byed pa'o //🔽chos ni skye ba'am /
analyzed: par byed pa de'ang nam mkha' rnam par rig par byed pa'o // chos ni skye ba'am /
translated: In the same way, the cognition of any dharma is the cognition of space.

original: 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Dharmas do not arise or cease.

original: chos thams cad kyi rnam par rig par byed pa ni rnam par rig par byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rnam par rig par byed pa ni rnam par rig par byed pa med pa'o //
translated: The cognition of all dharmas is non-cognition.🔽Those who have understood that dharma are also not otherwise.

original: chos des gang kun shes par byas pa de dag kyang gzhan du ma 'gyur bas na rnam par rig par byed pa med pas kun shes so //
analyzed: chos des gang kun shes par byas pa de dag kyang gzhan du ma 'gyur bas na rnam par rig par byed pa med pas kun shes so //
translated: Therefore, one understands through non-cognition.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: chos rnam par rig par byed pa de ji 'dra ba de bzhin du de'i kun shes pa'ang de 'dra ste /
analyzed: chos rnam par rig par byed pa de ji 'dra ba de bzhin du de'i kun shes pa'ang de 'dra ste /
translated: Just as the cognition of dharmas is, so is the understanding of it.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad de bzhin nyid la gnas zhes bya ste de bzhin nyid ni mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad de bzhin nyid la gnas zhes bya ste de bzhin nyid ni mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, all dharmas are said to abide in suchness, but suchness does not abide.

original: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa'ang 'khor de nyid du tshogs nas 'dug par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa'ang 'khor de nyid du tshogs nas 'dug par gyur te /
translated: Then the Four Great Kings, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, and Brahmā, Lord of the Sahā World, also gathered in that very retinue.

original: de dag lha'i me tog de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa la gtor nas tshig 'di skad 'dzer to //
analyzed: de dag lha'i me tog de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa la gtor nas tshig 'di skad 'dzer to //
translated: Having scattered those divine flowers over the Tathāgata, they said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: those sons of good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bstan pa 'di la mos pa de dag ni bdud dang / phyir rgol ba bcom pa lags so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bstan pa 'di la mos pa de dag ni bdud dang / phyir rgol ba bcom pa lags so //
translated: or daughters of good family who have faith in this teaching by Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, have conquered Māra and his adversaries.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bstan pa ni 'du shes thams cad dang bral ba lags te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bstan pa ni 'du shes thams cad dang bral ba lags te /
translated: the teaching by Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, is free from all notions.🔽Those sons of good family

original: gang chos zab mo bstan pa 'di la mi skrag mi dngang zhing shin tu dngang bar mi 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: gang chos zab mo bstan pa 'di la mi skrag mi dngang zhing shin tu dngang bar mi 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: or daughters of good family who are not afraid, terrified, or utterly terrified of this teaching of the profound Dharma

original: @130b rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ngan ngon dang ldan pa ma lags so //
analyzed: @130b rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ngan ngon dang ldan pa ma lags so //
translated: Those sons and daughters of good family do not have a small amount of wholesome roots.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'dis phyogs gang du byung ba de sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs pa lags so //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'dis phyogs gang du byung ba de sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs pa lags so //
translated: the place where this Dharma discourse arises is blessed by the Buddha.

original: gang du chos kyi tshul zab mo 'di thos par 'gyur ba'i sa phyogs de dag de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su longs spyad pa'o //
analyzed: gang du chos kyi tshul zab mo 'di thos par 'gyur ba'i sa phyogs de dag de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su longs spyad pa'o //
translated: The places where this profound Dharma way is heard are enjoyed by the Thus-Gone One.

original: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / gtsug lag khang dang / 'chags gang du chos kyi rnam grangs 'di byung ba der chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bar blta'o //
analyzed: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / gtsug lag khang dang / 'chags gang du chos kyi rnam grangs 'di byung ba der chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bar blta'o //
translated: In the villages, towns, cities, countries, temples, and parks where this Dharma discourse occurs, the wheel of Dharma should be seen to be turning.

original: der bdud rnams rgyu ba ma mchis /
analyzed: der bdud rnams rgyu ba ma mchis /
translated: There, the māras do not roam.

original: dmigs pa la mngon par chags pa rnams kyi rgyu ba ma mchis te /
analyzed: dmigs pa la mngon par chags pa rnams kyi rgyu ba ma mchis te /
translated: Those who are attached to reference points do not roam.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sems can sngon gyi rgyal ba rnams la lhag par bgyi ba bgyis pa rnams kyi rna lam du chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can sngon gyi rgyal ba rnams la lhag par bgyi ba bgyis pa rnams kyi rna lam du chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: May this Dharma discourse be heard in the ears of those sentient beings who have served the victorious ones of the past.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di ltar bdag cag gis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di las chos kyi snang ba thob ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag cag gis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di las chos kyi snang ba thob ste /
translated: in this way, we have obtained the light of Dharma from this Dharma discourse.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dang / tshangs pa 'di la bdag cag gis rang gi sha dang / khrag gis kyang lan mi lon no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dang / tshangs pa 'di la bdag cag gis rang gi sha dang / khrag gis kyang lan mi lon no //
translated: Blessed One, we cannot repay the Thus-Gone One, Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, and Brahmā with even our flesh and blood.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang las chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos par 'gyur ba'i chos smra ba de la bdag cag ston par 'du shes bskyed par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang las chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos par 'gyur ba'i chos smra ba de la bdag cag ston par 'du shes bskyed par bgyi'o //
translated: Blessed One, we will regard the Dharma teacher from whom we hear this Dharma discourse as our teacher.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,🔽we will always be present

original: chos smra ba de'i drung du bdag cag rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par @131a *//
analyzed: chos smra ba de'i drung du bdag cag rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par @131a *//
translated: in the presence of that Dharma teacher.

original: mchi ste / rigs kyi bu de lha de dag gis yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchi ste / rigs kyi bu de lha de dag gis yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Son of noble family, that son of noble family will be sustained by those gods.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di yi ger 'dri ba'am /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di yi ger 'dri ba'am /
translated: If this Dharma discourse is written down,

original: klog gam / ston tam /
analyzed: klog gam / ston tam /
translated: read, taught,

original: kha ton byed na lha'i bu brgya stong phrag du ma chos nyan du mchi'o //

analyzed: rnam par mi byed pa 'di ni chos kyi nan tan no //

original: gang dge ba la'ang mi 'jug /
analyzed: gang dge ba la'ang mi 'jug /

analyzed: mi dge ba la'ang mi 'jug pa 'di ni chos kyi nan tan no // de bzhin du bsdus te / 'jig rten pa la'ang ma yin /

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa la ma yin /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa la ma yin /🔽zag pa med pa la ma yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa la ma yin / zag pa dang bcas pa la ma yin / zag pa med pa la ma yin /

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa la ma yin /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa la ma yin /
translated: One does not engage in that which is reprehensible,🔽nor does one engage in that which is irreproachable.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa la ma yin /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa la ma yin /

original: 'dus byas la ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus byas la ma yin /

original: @134a *// 'dus ma byas la ma yin /
analyzed: @134a *// 'dus ma byas la ma yin /
translated: not in the unconditioned,

original: 'khor ba la ma yin /
analyzed: 'khor ba la ma yin /
translated: not in saṃsāra,🔽and not in nirvāṇa.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la mi 'jug pa 'di ni chos kyi nan tan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la mi 'jug pa 'di ni chos kyi nan tan zhes bya ste /

original: chos thams cad la nan tan du bya ba med pa 'di ni chos kyi nan tan no //
analyzed: chos thams cad la nan tan du bya ba med pa 'di ni chos kyi nan tan no //
translated: The practice of the Dharma is the absence of practice with regard to all phenomena.

original: chos su 'du shes pa la chos kyi nan tan med de /🔽chos 'di la nan tan bya'o zhes spro bar byed /
analyzed: chos su 'du shes pa la chos kyi nan tan med de / chos 'di la nan tan bya'o zhes spro bar byed /
translated: There is no practice of the Dharma in the perception of phenomena.🔽If one is enthusiastic about the idea that ‘I should practice this Dharma’ or ‘I should not practice this Dharma,’ then one has not entered.

original: nan tan du mi bya'o zhes spro bar byed na ma zhugs pa'o; ;chos thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i nan tan 'di ni chos kyi nan tan no //
analyzed: nan tan du mi bya'o zhes spro bar byed na ma zhugs pa'o; ;chos thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i nan tan 'di ni chos kyi nan tan no //
translated: The practice of following all phenomena is the practice of the Dharma.

original: spros pa med pas gnyen po med pa 'di ni chos kyi nan tan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spros pa med pas gnyen po med pa 'di ni chos kyi nan tan zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of antidotes due to the absence of conceptual elaboration is called the practice of the Dharma.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i bu phyir mi ldog pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i bu phyir mi ldog pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the irreversible god asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

analyzed: gang yang dag pa'i nan tan 'di la zhugs pa dang / 'jug par 'gyur ba de dag la shin tu log pa'i nan tan ma mchis so //
translated: Those who have entered into or will enter into this right practice will not have any wrong practice.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shin tu yang dag pa'i nan tan 'di lags te /
analyzed: shin tu yang dag pa'i nan tan 'di lags te /
translated: this is right practice.

original: log pa'i lam du zhugs pa rnams la nan tan gang yang ma mchis so //
analyzed: log pa'i lam du zhugs pa rnams la nan tan gang yang ma mchis so //
translated: Those who have entered the wrong path do not have any practice at all.

original: yang dag pa'i lam la gnas pa rnams la chos kyi nan tan ma mchis so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam la gnas pa rnams la chos kyi nan tan ma mchis so //
translated: Those who abide on the right path do not have the practice of the Dharma.

original: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la ni mi mnyam pa'i chos gang yang ma mchis so //
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la ni mi mnyam pa'i chos gang yang ma mchis so //
translated: Those who have entered the right path do not have any unevenness.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad ni mnyam pa khyad par ma mchis ba'o //🔽de nas tshangs pa khyad par sems kyis lha'i bu de la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mnyam pa khyad par ma mchis ba'o // de nas tshangs pa khyad par sems kyis lha'i bu de la 'di skad ces smras so //

original: lha'i bu @134b khyod; nan tan 'di la zhugs sam /
analyzed: lha'i bu @134b khyod; nan tan 'di la zhugs sam /
translated: Then Brahma Viśeṣacintin said to that god, “God, have you entered into this practice?”

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa /
translated: He replied, “Brahmā,

analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis nan tan la gnyis su bshad par gyur na bdag kyang nan tan 'di la nan tan du byed do //
translated: If the Lord had taught two kinds of earnest practice, I would have practiced earnestly.

original: nan tan ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: nan tan ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: But earnest practice is nondual.

original: de la gang nan tan byed pa dang / gang la nan tan byed pa de'ang med do //
analyzed: de la gang nan tan byed pa dang / gang la nan tan byed pa de'ang med do //
translated: There is no one who practices earnestly, nor anything on which to practice earnestly.

original: gang yang nan tan du byed par med do //
analyzed: gang yang nan tan du byed par med do //
translated: And there is no one who practices earnestly.

original: 'on kyang / tshangs pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang / tshangs pa /
translated: Brahma,

original: bdag ni lhag par mi byed pa dang / sgro mi 'dogs pa'i phyir nan tan 'di la zhugs so //
analyzed: bdag ni lhag par mi byed pa dang / sgro mi 'dogs pa'i phyir nan tan 'di la zhugs so //
translated: I have entered this earnest practice in order not to do anything and not to impute anything.

original: chos nyid ji lta bar chos kyi nan tan yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: chos nyid ji lta bar chos kyi nan tan yang de bzhin te /
translated: The nature of things is the same as the earnest practice of the Dharma.

original: de ni de bzhin nyid la de ltar zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin nyid la de ltar zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called ‘entering suchness. ’”

original: tshangs pas smras pa; lha'i bu khyod /
analyzed: tshangs pas smras pa; lha'i bu khyod /
translated: Brahma said, “Son of the gods,

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di na sngon ngas ma mthong ngo //
translated: I have never seen such a thing in this buddhafield before.”

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dis kyang sngon bdag ma mthong ngo //
translated: this buddhafield has never seen me before either.”

analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di ni blta'o zhe'am / mi lta'o zhes rtog pa'am /

original: rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: He replied, “Brahmā, this buddha realm is not conceptualized or discriminated as ‘I see it’ or ‘I do not see it.’🔽”

original: smras pa / tshangs pa /🔽bdag sngon mthong ngo zhe'am /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa / bdag sngon mthong ngo zhe'am /
translated: He replied, “Brahmā,

original: sngon ma mthong ngo zhes bdag kyang mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: sngon ma mthong ngo zhes bdag kyang mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: I do not conceptualize or discriminate as ‘I have seen it before’ or ‘I have not seen it before.’🔽”

original: smras pa; lha'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa; lha'i bu /
translated: He replied, “Son of the victors,

original: sngon ma mthong ba mthong ba su /
analyzed: sngon ma mthong ba mthong ba su /
translated: who sees what has not been seen before?”

analyzed: smras pa / byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyis ni 'phags pa'i nges par 'jug pa sngon ma mthong ngo //

analyzed: tshangs pa / nam yang dag par nges par zhugs pa de ni sngon ma mthong ba mthong ngo //

analyzed: nges pa de ni mig gi rnam par shes pas shes pa ma yin / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pas @135a *//
translated: That definite entry is not known by the eye consciousness,

original: shes par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: shes par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: nor is it known by the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind consciousness.

original: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen just as suchness is.”

original: mig gi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba dang / rna ba'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba dang / sna'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba dang / lce'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba dang / lus kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba dang / yid kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du blta ste; gang de ltar mthong ba de dag ni yang dag par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: mig gi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba dang / rna ba'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba dang / sna'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba dang / lce'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba dang / lus kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba dang / yid kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du blta ste; gang de ltar mthong ba de dag ni yang dag par mthong ba'o //
translated: The suchness of the eye is just as it is, the suchness of the ear is just as it is, the suchness of the nose is just as it is, the suchness of the tongue is just as it is, the suchness of the body is just as it is, and the suchness of the mind is just as it is. Those who see in this way see correctly.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ded dpon nor bu rin po che'i gling du phyin pa'i mig sngar ni nor bu rin po che 'ba' zhig gda'o //
analyzed: ded dpon nor bu rin po che'i gling du phyin pa'i mig sngar ni nor bu rin po che 'ba' zhig gda'o //
translated: for the caravan leader who has reached the island of jewels, there are only jewels everywhere.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: skyes bu dam pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos rin po che dang ldan pa rnams ci dang / ci spobs pa de dag gis de thams cad chos rin po che nyid du spobs so //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos rin po che dang ldan pa rnams ci dang / ci spobs pa de dag gis de thams cad chos rin po che nyid du spobs so //
translated: whatever those who possess the jewel of the inconceivable Dharma of the good man speak of, whatever they are eloquent about, all that is the jewel of the Dharma.

analyzed: de nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' yongs su gsal bar bgyid par spobs so //
translated: I am confident in elucidating the very limit of reality.

original: 'di ltar de dag la bdag la bdag tu mngon par chags pa ma mchis /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la bdag la bdag tu mngon par chags pa ma mchis /
translated: Because they are not attached to a self,

original: chos su mngon par chags pa ma mchis /
analyzed: chos su mngon par chags pa ma mchis /
translated: they are not attached to phenomena,

analyzed: sems can du mngon par chags pa ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
translated: and they are not attached to sentient beings.

analyzed: de'i slad du ji ltar mi log pa dang / phyin ci ma log par spobs pa de de ltar spobs so //

translated: They are confident in speaking without seeing a beginning, without seeing an end, and without seeing the present.

original: ji ltar ma mos @135b pa rnams kyang mos par bgyid la /🔽mos pa rnams kyang rnam par 'grol ba de de ltar spobs so //
analyzed: ji ltar ma mos @135b pa rnams kyang mos par bgyid la / mos pa rnams kyang rnam par 'grol ba de de ltar spobs so //
translated: They are confident in speaking in order to inspire faith in those who lack faith,🔽and in order to liberate those who have faith.
