analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams kyang tshar bcad par 'gyur la /
translated: They are confident in speaking in order to defeat those with excessive pride,🔽and in order to inspire faith in those with little pride.

analyzed: nga rgyal ma mchis pa kun 'tshal ba lan ldon pa de ltar spobs so //
translated: I have no pride, but I do have the eloquence to answer your question.

original: ji ltar bdud kyis glags mi rnyed pa de ltar spobs so //
analyzed: ji ltar bdud kyis glags mi rnyed pa de ltar spobs so //

analyzed: gang de ltar nyan pa de dag kyang bdud kyi las las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who listen in this way will transcend the works of Māra.

translated: I have the eloquence to explain how those who have not planted the roots of virtue will plant them, how those who have planted the roots of virtue will not lose them, how those who have given rise to afflictions will abandon them, and how those who have not given rise to afflictions will not give rise to them.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' go cha ma bgos pa rnams go cha 'tshal ba dang / go cha bgos pa rnams mi ldog par 'gyur ba de ltar spobs so //
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' go cha ma bgos pa rnams go cha 'tshal ba dang / go cha bgos pa rnams mi ldog par 'gyur ba de ltar spobs so //
translated: I have the eloquence to explain how bodhisattvas who have not donned the armor will don it, and how those who have donned the armor will not turn back.

original: ji ltar dam pa'i chos mi 'chang cing dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung bar bgyid pa de ltar spobs so //
analyzed: ji ltar dam pa'i chos mi 'chang cing dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung bar bgyid pa de ltar spobs so //
translated: I have the eloquence to explain how those who do not uphold the sublime Dharma will uphold it and how those who uphold the sublime Dharma will not lose it.”

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de ltar spobs so //
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de ltar spobs so //
translated: I have the eloquence to explain how all the qualities of the Buddha are perfected.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: de lta bu'i spobs pas ni mu stegs kyi gnas thams cad gzhom par nus so //
translated: with such eloquence, I am able to defeat all the positions of the tīrthikas.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

translated: in the same way, all opponents are unable to bear the lion’s roar of the unsurpassed.

analyzed: seng ge'i sgra seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ba ji tsam gyis na seng ge'i sgra zhes bya /
translated: What is meant by the lion’s roar?

analyzed: chos gang la'ang mngon par ma chags par brjod pa de dag seng ge'i sgra yin no //

analyzed: gang lta ba kun tu slong ba ston pa de dag la seng ge'i sgra med do; ;lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis smras pa /

analyzed: lha'i bu khyod seng ge'i sgra ji lta bu yin pa spobs par gyis shig /
translated: “Son of a god, be confident in explaining what the lion’s roar is like.”🔽He replied,

original: smras pa / koo shi ka /
analyzed: smras pa / koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang mngon par ma chags par ston na chos ngan pa gzhan lta ci smos te /

analyzed: de'i phyir seng ge'i sgra zhes bya'o //

original: de'i phyir seng ge'i sgra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir seng ge'i sgra zhes bya'o //
translated: That is why it is called the lion’s roar.

original: 'di ni mgo gcig tu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni mgo gcig tu bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is a teaching that is one-sided.

original: de'i phyir seng ge'i sgra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir seng ge'i sgra zhes bya'o //
translated: That is why it is called the lion’s roar.

original: 'di ni mi skrag par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mi skrag par bstan pa ste /
translated: This is a teaching that is not frightening.

original: de'i phyir seng ge'i sgra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir seng ge'i sgra zhes bya'o //
translated: That is why it is called the lion’s roar.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

analyzed: gang chos thams cad mi skye ba dang / mi 'gog pa dang / mi 'thob par sgom pa'i phyir chos bstan pa de dag ni seng ge'i sgra yin te /
translated: Those teachings of the Dharma which are for the sake of meditating on the non-production, non-cessation, and non-attainment of all phenomena are the lion’s roar.

original: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston ba de dag la seng ge'i sgra med do //
analyzed: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston ba de dag la seng ge'i sgra med do //
translated: Those teachings of the Dharma which are for the sake of afflictive and purified phenomena, and for the sake of binding and separating, do not have the lion’s roar.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika!

original: seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ba 'di lta ste /
translated: The so-called lion’s roar is as follows:

original: mgo gcig tu bstan pa /
analyzed: mgo gcig tu bstan pa /
translated: It is the teaching of one-sidedness.

original: chos thams cad gang zag med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad gang zag med pa /
translated: All phenomena are without person,

original: bdag med @136b pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag med @136b pa yin no //
translated: and are without self.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika!

original: seng ge'i sgra seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The so-called lion’s roar is as follows:

original: mgo gcig tu chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yongs su rtogs pa ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
analyzed: mgo gcig tu chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yongs su rtogs pa ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
translated: The realization of all phenomena as one-sided emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness is the lion’s roar.

original: dam pa'i chos bsrung ba'i phyir tshig smra ba ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bsrung ba'i phyir tshig smra ba ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
translated: Speaking words for the sake of protecting the sublime Dharma is the lion’s roar.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sems can thams cad rab tu thar bar bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas su gyur cig ces byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i tshig smra ba ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad rab tu thar bar bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas su gyur cig ces byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i tshig smra ba ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
translated: The words “May I become a Buddha in order to liberate all beings” are the lion’s roar.

original: longs spyod rung ba la chog shes par smra ba ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rung ba la chog shes par smra ba ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
translated: The words “I am satisfied with the enjoyment of wealth” are the lion’s roar.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the lion’s roar is as follows:

original: dgon par gnas pa dang / yang dag par len pa dang / gtong ba sngon du 'gro ba ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
analyzed: dgon par gnas pa dang / yang dag par len pa dang / gtong ba sngon du 'gro ba ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
translated: Living in the wilderness, taking up the right path, and giving away are the lion’s roar.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa mi 'dor ba ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa mi 'dor ba ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
translated: Not abandoning the precepts of correct conduct is the lion’s roar.

original: mdza' ba dang / mi mdza' ba la sems mnyam pa ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
analyzed: mdza' ba dang / mi mdza' ba la sems mnyam pa ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
translated: Having an equal attitude toward friends and enemies is the lion’s roar.

original: brtson pa mi 'dor ba ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
analyzed: brtson pa mi 'dor ba ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
translated: Not abandoning effort is the lion’s roar.

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
translated: Abandoning the afflictions is the lion’s roar.

original: shes rab kyis shin tu brtags pa ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis shin tu brtags pa ni seng ge'i sgra'o //
translated: Thoroughly investigating with wisdom is the lion’s roar.

original: seng ge'i sgra bstan pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g-yos so //
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra bstan pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g-yos so //
translated: When this teaching of the lion’s roar was explained, the worlds of the great trichiliocosm shook in six ways.

original: sil snyan brgya stong du ma ma brdung bar sgra 'byin te //
analyzed: sil snyan brgya stong du ma ma brdung bar sgra 'byin te //
translated: Hundreds of thousands of musical instruments sounded without being played.

original: 'jig rten rnams snang ba chen pos khyab par gyur to //🔽lha'i bu brgya stong aa la la zhes sgra 'byin cing tshig 'di skad ces smras so //🔽ae ma'o // deng 'dir lha'i bus seng ge'i sgra 'di bsgrags pas dzambu gling du chos kyi 'khor lo @137a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams snang ba chen pos khyab par gyur to // lha'i bu brgya stong aa la la zhes sgra 'byin cing tshig 'di skad ces smras so // ae ma'o // deng 'dir lha'i bus seng ge'i sgra 'di bsgrags pas dzambu gling du chos kyi 'khor lo @137a *//
translated: The world was pervaded by a great light.

original: bskor ba lan gnyis byung ngo //
analyzed: bskor ba lan gnyis byung ngo //
translated: Hundreds of thousands of gods cried out, “Ah! Ah!” and said, “Today, the gods have roared the lion’s roar here, and the wheel of the Dharma has been turned twice in Jambudvīpa.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad pa dang / chos nyid kyis 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad pa dang / chos nyid kyis 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Then the Blessed One smiled, and it is natural that when the blessed buddhas smile,

original: nam sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'dzum par mdzad pa de'i tshe 'od zer kha dog sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nam sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'dzum par mdzad pa de'i tshe 'od zer kha dog sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
translated: rays of many different colors—blue, yellow, red, white, crimson, crystal, silver, and golden—issue forth from their mouths.

original: mthing ka dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / leb rgan dang / shel dang / dngul gyi kha dog lta bu zhal nas byung ste /
analyzed: mthing ka dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / leb rgan dang / shel dang / dngul gyi kha dog lta bu zhal nas byung ste /
translated: yellow, red, white, purple, crystal, and silver.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa khyab par byas nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du mngon par 'phags te phyir log nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa khyab par byas nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du mngon par 'phags te phyir log nas /
translated: They pervaded infinite world systems, reaching as far as the Brahma world.

original: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyi bor mi snang bar gyur to ////🔽bam po drug pa ste tha ma /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyi bor mi snang bar gyur to //// bam po drug pa ste tha ma /
translated: Then they returned, circled the Blessed One three times, and disappeared into the top of his head.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pa khyad par sems kyis tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pa khyad par sems kyis tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod do //
translated: Then Brahma Viśeṣacintin praised the Blessed One with these verses:

original: ye shes kun mchog pha rol phyin cing thub pa kun mkhyen kun zil non //
analyzed: ye shes kun mchog pha rol phyin cing thub pa kun mkhyen kun zil non //
translated: “You have perfected all wisdom, O Sage, and outshine all omniscient ones.

original: 'di la dus gsum sems can spyod pa sna tshogs ci mchis khyod kyis mkhyen //
analyzed: 'di la dus gsum sems can spyod pa sna tshogs ci mchis khyod kyis mkhyen //
translated: You know all the various activities of beings in the three times.

original: gang de shin tu grol ba'i blo yul gang yang de dag bsam pa rnams //
analyzed: gang de shin tu grol ba'i blo yul gang yang de dag bsam pa rnams //
translated: Those with liberated minds have no thoughts at all.

original: lha yi gtso bo kun mkhyen 'dzum mdzad 'di yi rgyu ni lung bstan gsol //
analyzed: lha yi gtso bo kun mkhyen 'dzum mdzad 'di yi rgyu ni lung bstan gsol //
translated: “The cause of the smile of the omniscient lord of gods is the prophecy.

original: nyan thos rang rgyal dgra bcom dri med de dag gis kyang spyod yul min //
analyzed: nyan thos rang rgyal dgra bcom dri med de dag gis kyang spyod yul min //
translated: Even the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and arhats, who are stainless, do not have that.

original: sangs rgyas ye shes bsam mi khyab cing mtha' bral khyod la chags pa med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ye shes bsam mi khyab cing mtha' bral khyod la chags pa med //
translated: “The wisdom of the buddhas is inconceivable and free of extremes. You are free of attachment.

original: khyod kyis sems can spyod pa sems can gang la @137b ci 'dra'i gtam brjod mkhyen //
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can spyod pa sems can gang la @137b ci 'dra'i gtam brjod mkhyen //
translated: You know the conduct of beings and what kind of speech to give to beings.

original: smra mchog thub dka' tshig dbang 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu ni bstan par gsol //
analyzed: smra mchog thub dka' tshig dbang 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu ni bstan par gsol //
translated: Supreme speaker, difficult to defeat, lord of speech, please teach the cause of your smile.

original: 'od 'di shin tu yid 'ong sdug pa dri med rab tu rnam par mdzes //
analyzed: 'od 'di shin tu yid 'ong sdug pa dri med rab tu rnam par mdzes //
translated: “This light is very beautiful, attractive, stainless, and very lovely.

original: nyi zla'i 'od dang de bzhin tshangs pa dbang po'i gzi yang zil gyis gnon //
analyzed: nyi zla'i 'od dang de bzhin tshangs pa dbang po'i gzi yang zil gyis gnon //
translated: It outshines the light of the sun and moon and also the splendor of Brahmā and Śakra.

original: de bzhin khor yug khrag khrig ri rab dag kyang shin tu snang bgyis na //
analyzed: de bzhin khor yug khrag khrig ri rab dag kyang shin tu snang bgyis na //
translated: In the same way, it illuminates a quintillion surrounding mountains and Mount Sumeru.

original: ci slad khyod kyis 'dzum mdzad de yi rgyu ni rab tu bstan par gsol //
analyzed: ci slad khyod kyis 'dzum mdzad de yi rgyu ni rab tu bstan par gsol //
translated: For what reason did you smile? Please teach the cause of that.”

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang dregs la sogs pa zug rdu bral zhing rab tu zhi //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang dregs la sogs pa zug rdu bral zhing rab tu zhi //
translated: Free from the pain of desire, hatred, pride, and so on, you are completely peaceful.

original: 'jig rten lha mi lto 'phye'i tshogs rnams byams pas bdag po khyod zhal lta //
analyzed: 'jig rten lha mi lto 'phye'i tshogs rnams byams pas bdag po khyod zhal lta //
translated: With love, you are the lord of the hosts of worldly gods, humans, and mahoragas, who look to you.

original: bde gshegs bltas kyang mi ngoms lus ni rab tu sim zhing bde bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bde gshegs bltas kyang mi ngoms lus ni rab tu sim zhing bde bar 'gyur //
translated: Even when we look at the Sugata, we are never satisfied, and our bodies are refreshed and blissful.

original: gang gi slad du 'dzum pa 'di bstan thub pa bdag cag rnams la gsungs //
analyzed: gang gi slad du 'dzum pa 'di bstan thub pa bdag cag rnams la gsungs //
translated: For what reason did you smile? O Sage, tell us!🔽You know that phenomena are always like space, without action, and empty,🔽like lightning and clouds, illusory, hollow, and like foam,

original: khyod kyis chos rnams nam mkha' lta bur rtag tu byed med gsog nyid dang // glog dang sprin 'dra sgyu ma lta bur gsob nyid dbu ba lta bu dang // rmi lam mthong dang chad pa stong 'dra nam mkha' chu zla lta bur mkhyen //
analyzed: khyod kyis chos rnams nam mkha' lta bur rtag tu byed med gsog nyid dang // glog dang sprin 'dra sgyu ma lta bur gsob nyid dbu ba lta bu dang // rmi lam mthong dang chad pa stong 'dra nam mkha' chu zla lta bur mkhyen //
translated: like seeing a dream, like an echo, like the sky, and like the moon in water.

original: dge ba 'dzum mdzad 'di rgyu rnar snyan gsung ni rab tu brjod par mdzod //
analyzed: dge ba 'dzum mdzad 'di rgyu rnar snyan gsung ni rab tu brjod par mdzod //
translated: For that reason, you smile. Please speak those pleasant-sounding words.

original: 'dzin dang rtog dang rnam rtog kun dang bral bas stong pa nyid la mos //
analyzed: 'dzin dang rtog dang rnam rtog kun dang bral bas stong pa nyid la mos //
translated: You are free from grasping, concepts, and all discursive thought, and you delight in emptiness.

original: bdag po shes bya kun la rtog bral rtag tu mtshan ma med la dgyes //
analyzed: bdag po shes bya kun la rtog bral rtag tu mtshan ma med la dgyes //
translated: You are the master, free from concepts about all objects of knowledge, always delighting in the absence of characteristics.

original: khyod ni srid pa gsum 'dir gang la'ang mi smon bsam gtan ting 'dzin dgyes //
analyzed: khyod ni srid pa gsum 'dir gang la'ang mi smon bsam gtan ting 'dzin dgyes //
translated: You have no wishes for anything in these three existences, delighting in meditative concentration and absorption.

original: gang gi slad du 'dzum pa bstan mdzad 'dren pa 'di ni lung bstan gsol //
analyzed: gang gi slad du 'dzum pa bstan mdzad 'dren pa 'di ni lung bstan gsol //
translated: Guide, please explain the reasons why you have smiled.

original: skad la mi chags sgra dang dbyangs @138a *//
analyzed: skad la mi chags sgra dang dbyangs @138a *//
translated: You are not attached to sounds,

original: dang yi ge dag la'ang de bzhin te //
analyzed: dang yi ge dag la'ang de bzhin te //
translated: and the same is true of words, melodies, and letters.

original: 'jig rten du yang chos ston blo gtsang bdag dang chos la'ang gnas mi mdzad //
analyzed: 'jig rten du yang chos ston blo gtsang bdag dang chos la'ang gnas mi mdzad //
translated: You teach the Dharma in the world with a pure mind, but you do not dwell on yourself or the Dharma.

original: 'dus pa so sor bde gshegs bdag la tha dad chos ston snyam du 'dzin //
analyzed: 'dus pa so sor bde gshegs bdag la tha dad chos ston snyam du 'dzin //
translated: You think that the Thus-Gone One teaches the Dharma differently to each assembly.

original: ye shes rdzu 'phrul dbang po stobs mchog rgyas pa shes rab mtshungs med gsungs //
analyzed: ye shes rdzu 'phrul dbang po stobs mchog rgyas pa shes rab mtshungs med gsungs //
translated: You have perfect wisdom, knowledge, miraculous powers, faculties, and strengths.

original: khyod ni sdug bsngal kun sel na rga 'chi 'joms sman pa'i mchog lags te //
analyzed: khyod ni sdug bsngal kun sel na rga 'chi 'joms sman pa'i mchog lags te //
translated: You are the supreme medicine that cures all suffering, the conqueror of old age and death.

original: khyod ni dpa' bo bdud kyi stobs 'joms mthu bo che yi mthu dang ldan //
analyzed: khyod ni dpa' bo bdud kyi stobs 'joms mthu bo che yi mthu dang ldan //
translated: You are a hero who conquers the power of Māra, possessing the strength of a mighty one.

original: khyod ni skyob pas dpung gnyen 'jig rten mgon skyabs sgron ma snang mdzad pa //
analyzed: khyod ni skyob pas dpung gnyen 'jig rten mgon skyabs sgron ma snang mdzad pa //
translated: You are the protector, the friend, the guardian of the world, the lamp that shines with light.🔽“What is the cause of your smile, O you who are worshipped by the gods, the asuras, and the nāgas?

original: lha min lha dang klus mchod 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu gang 'dir bstan gsol //🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa khyad par sems la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: lha min lha dang klus mchod 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu gang 'dir bstan gsol // de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa khyad par sems la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Please explain.”

original: tshangs pa / khyod kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i lha'i bu 'di mthong ngam /
analyzed: tshangs pa / khyod kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i lha'i bu 'di mthong ngam /
translated: The Blessed One said to Brahmaṇīpati, “Brahmā, do you see this irreversible divine son?”🔽“Yes, I do.”
